Purpose: To quantitatively measure methylmalonic acid levels in urine for diagnosing and managing conditions associated with MMA elevation.
Container: Clean, contamination-free urine container (e.g., standard urine collection cup or 24-hour collection container with preservative if specified)
Equipment: Liquid Chromatography–Mass Spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) or Gas Chromatography–Mass Spectrometry (GC-MS) system
